ygData.authorName: Reece Tom R CPT 25 ID L G4(n)
ygData.from: "Reece Tom R CPT 25 ID L G4(n)" <g4mntofcr@...>
ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Official confirmation from Ester
ygData.msgSnippet: I think a lot of other EQ players have the same sentiment as you.  They are sticking with EQ because of the friendships they have made in the game within their
ygData.messageBody:
I think a lot of other EQ players have the same sentiment as you. They are
sticking with EQ because of the friendships they have made in the game
within their guild. My entire guild (50+ players) is chomping at the bit to
play NWN. As soon as NWN is released, all of us will quit EQ. We have at
least five people who are going to create their own dungeons/campaign
settings and set up persistent servers. I'm not exactly certain how the
technology end of it will work, but players will be able to link their
computers together to set up a semi-persistant world.

Galtin

-----Original Message-----
From: Big Daddy Legba [mailto:legba@...]
Sent: Friday, September 08, 2000 3:39 AM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Official confirmation from Ester


However if my guild said "Hey Elf, we've decided to move the guild to
xxxxxxxx (anarchy online, asheron's call, UO2, Diablo2, Icewind Dale,
whatever)" I would leave in a second. But that being said I don't see it
happening, and will continue enjoying my time in Norrath with my friends.
(despite the occasional quirks...)


Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
